text: Red Oak is an 830-megawatt combined cycle gas turbine power plant located in Sayreville, New Jersey not far from the South River opened on 2002. Energy Capital acquired it from a subsidiary of the AES Corporation in April 2012, which, in November 2013, sold it to the Carlyle Group. Damage to the plant due to Hurricane Sandy in 2012 took it offline line for five months. http://www.thedeal.com/content/energy/powerful-forces-push-generation- deals.php TAQA subsidiary TAQA Gen-X owns 85% and Morgan Stanley owns 15% of the tolling agreement for the facility through its with partner. Natural gas is provided by New Jersey Resources.http://www.state.nj.us/bpu/pdf/boardorders/2014/20141022/10-22-14-2C.pdfhttp://www.njresources.com/news/releases/2013/njng/14-13-TAQA- RedOak.asp It is part of the PJM Interconnection of the Eastern Interconnection grid electric transmission system. A 2013 report named It is one of the largest single sources of carbon pollution in the state. The Sayreville Energy Center operated by NextEra Energy Resources is nearby. ==See also== *Neptune Cable *List of power stations in New Jersey == References == == External links == *Wikimapia Category:Power stations in Middlesex County, New Jersey Category:Natural gas-fired power stations in New Jersey Category:Sayreville, New Jersey Category:Neighborhoods in Sayreville, New Jersey
title: Red Oak Power
